data.title: Royston Langdon With Spacehog and Special Guests Liv Tyler & Sean Lennon Team Up for a Live Rooftop Performance Event
meta_keywords: Royston Langdon & Spacehog With Special Guests
data.meta_description: New York, NY (PRWEB) October 10, 2013 -- Royston Langdon with Spacehog, as well as special guests Liv Tyler, Sean Lennon and Charlotte Kemp Muhl (The Ghost of...
data.text:
New York, NY (PRWEB) October 10, 2013 -- Royston Langdon with Spacehog, as well as special guests Liv Tyler, Sean Lennon and Charlotte Kemp Muhl (The Ghost of A Saber Tooth Tiger), will make a rare, live, intimate, interactive performance from a New York City rooftop on October 16 at 8:00pm EST. This one time only show, directed by Marc Scrivo of STUDIO SCRIVO, will benefit the David Lynch Foundation’s First Responders Initiative. The organization’s ongoing program brings Transcendental Meditation to first responders in need of coping techniques for stress, trauma, and more. The show can be seen via StageIt at http://bit.ly/spacehogstageit. Crowd-funded donations will be made during the show and will include bidding for unique merchandise and personal experiences with the participants. Tickets go on sale today. Spacehog lead singer Royston Langdon and Liv Tyler, both devotees of Transcendental Meditation, will perform a special original song, "You Can't Go Home Again" dedicated to the first responders.

Event co-founder Royston Langdon says, “We are beyond thrilled to be performing a benefit for the great David Lynch’s Foundation and the First Responders Initiative. I thank the very special performers Liv Tyler, Sean Lennon, Charlotte Kemp Muhl and of course the members of Spacehog. We all share a belief in peace and transformation and share our performance with our fans on behalf of these incredibly brave men and women.”

David Lynch commented, “I'm so happy that Royston, Spacehog, Sean, Charlotte, and Liv are beaming their sounds to your computer! It's such a beautiful thing to share the power of music."

Through the interactive StageIt platform, fans are encouraged to request songs, learn intimate details about the performances, make special donations and receive one of a kind experiences and swag.

Visit: http://bit.ly/spacehogstageit to purchase tickets now and to view the show on October 16th. #spacewithin

About Spacehog:

Fresh from their UK tour, Spacehog will create this one time concert experience entitled LIVE ON EARTH. Spacehog recently released its fourth album, As It Is On Earth, teaming up once again with producer Bryce Goggin, who helmed the band’s million-selling debut album, Resident Alien. Spacehog vocalist, bassist and chief songwriter Royston Langdon is co-founder of this event. His first professional songwriting assignment was for a David Lynch film, Nadja, and he actually held onto the check, signed by the famed filmmaker and director before finally cashing it. The band fully supports the work of the David Lynch Foundation and the First Responders Initiative as well as the practice of Transcendental Meditation.

Spacehog.com

@Spacehog

Facebook

About Marc Scrivo (Director/Co-Founder):

Marc Scrivo, event's co-Founder and 9/11 First-Responder will direct this unique creative endeavor. His Soho based STUDIO SCRIVO provides creative content for like-minded individuals with a desire to not only grow their brands, but expand their worldview. Marc began a meditation practice shortly after his experience volunteering at Ground Zero as a means of understanding his personal trauma living and working down there during that time. He is thrilled to be collaborating with Royston in raising awareness and funds for the vitally important work David Lynch is doing with his Foundation.

Facebook

Twitter

About the David Lynch Foundation

The David Lynch Foundation, a 501(c)(3) organization, was established in 2005 to fund the implementation of scientifically proven stress-reducing modalities including Transcendental Meditation, for at-risk populations such as underserved inner-city students; veterans with PTSD and their families; women and girls who

have been victims of violence, rape, and abuse, American Indians suffering from diabetes and high suicide rates; homeless adults and teens participating in reentry programs; and incarcerated adults and juveniles. For more information, visit http://www.davidlynchfoundation.org.

About StageIt:

Stageit empowers artists to deliver and monetize unique online live events anytime, anywhere while providing real-time social engagement with their fans. The online performances streamed on Stageit are not archived, so they remain truly unique experiences for the virtual attendees. Launched in 2011 by CEO and music industry veteran Evan Lowenstein, Stageit has hosted a wide range of performers including Jason Mraz, Jimmy Buffett, Trey Songz, Bonnie Raitt, KORN, Sara Bareilles, Plain White T’s and many more. The Los Angeles-based company was named one of the world’s Top 10 most innovative companies in music by Fast Company, appeared on Billboard.biz Bulletin’s list of 10 most interesting startups of 2012 and received the midemlab award in direct to consumer sales & content monetization at midem 2013.
